item.title: Press release - Polish Presidency debriefs EP committees on priorities
item.description:
Ministers are holding a series of meetings in parliamentary committees to present the priorities of the Polish Presidency of the Council.

Committee on Culture and Education
Committee on Employment and Social Affairs

Committee on Women’s Rights and Gender Equality

Committee on Industry, Research and Energy
Committee on Fisheries
Committee on Security and Defence
Committee on Transport and Tourism

item.title: Highlights - Welcoming of Mr Adam Szłapka, Minister for European Affairs of the Republic of Poland - Committee on Constitutional Affairs
item.description:
On 29 January, at the committee meeting AFCO had the pleasure of welcoming Mr Adam Szłapka, Minister for European Affairs of the Republic of Poland, who presented the programme of the Polish EU Council Presidency

More Pictures of the AFCO Committee meeting on 29 of January 2025

item.title: Minutes - Wednesday, 4 December 2024 - PE766.878v01-00 - Committee on Constitutional Affairs
item.description: Source : © European Union, 2024 - EP

item.title: Study - Towards a Climate and Energy Union - The constitutional basis for a sustainable transformation - PE 764.399 - Committee on Constitutional Affairs
item.description:
This study, commissioned by the European Parliament’s Policy Department for Citizens’ Rights and Constitutional Affairs at the request of the AFCO Committee, considers the legal space for an EU Climate and Energy Union. It assesses the major limits at the EU and national level, as well as the question if (informal) Treaty change is possible and necessary to create the space needed. It also assesses if an individual right to clean energy exists, or can and should be legally construed. It pays special attention to the challenge of funding and the role that the emerging principle of solidarity might play.

Study : EN
Executive summary : EN

Source : © European Union, 2024 - EP
